website_summaries.verdict: The Saucony Cohesion 10 is clearly a steal when one recognizes its value as a hard-nosed trainer or as a long-distance runner. While this lacks the best technologies from Saucony, it does offer a no-nonsense approach to those who require a moderately cushioned neutral shoe that does exactly and a bit more than expected. This lightweight running shoe is also perfect for those who are recreational runners, middle of the pack participants, entry-level runners and those who are budget conscious.
pros: A large number of the reviewers commented that the 10th edition of the Cohesion was extremely comfortable
It is lighter than the previous model
The shoe has surprisingly good durability, considering its price point, as reported by many runners
There were several reviewers who loved the way the shoe feels despite hours of work on their feet
More than a handful stated that they got compliments for how the Cohesion 10 looks
A good number of runners mentioned that they did not a break in period in this shoe
The support is highly appreciated by some runners and gym rats
Some reviewers use it for gym workouts
Available in multiple colors and widths
Features reflective elements for low-light running
cons: A handful noted that the forefoot cushioning is noticeably stiffer than the earlier model
It runs a little small and narrow, according to a few runners
The outsole grip is not as good when it rains, as noticed by some runner

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up from a marathoner
customer_reviews.text: I'm a heavy runner that typically does 40-55 miles per week, and these are honestly some of the most lightest and comfortable shoes I've ever worn. I typically run in Brooks or Salomon brand shoes, but I decided to give Saucony a try as a first timer. They fit just right without feeling narrow and tight on the sides. You won't realize that they're even on your feet from being so light, yet the support is there. I've also had zero problems with the laces. 4.5/5 and two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Nellom Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. Fit small.
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes, good quality at a good price, but they fit small. I am a size 11 in everything but with these shoes in a size 11 my toes actually make contact with the end of the toe box. Happily the return policy is very good and I am returning them to exchange for a size 11.5. Hopefully I won't need a 12!! TBD. Edit to Add: The 11.5 fit great and I really like the shoes. I suggest checking to see if the European size is correct for you. IN these shoes the size US11 were a EUR45. Most size US11 shoes are a EUR46. I think Saucony's conversion is the root of the sizing problem.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Best Running Shoe For The Money By Far
customer_reviews.text: These are the best made running shoes for the money by far. Myself and an the other runners in the family have been using the Saucony Cohesion for more than a decade. They are no frills but feel more comfortable and cushioned than any other brand. They are not too heavy. They are "neutral" meaning not for pronators or supinators. We have had no injuries from these and the various family members run between 20 and 85 MPW. The price cannot be beat and adjusted for inflation they seem to get cheaper every year. I will take these 35 dollar pair over any 150 dollar bells and whistle model any day of the week.
customer_reviews.author: KarenM

customer_reviews.title: Are these really wide-width shoes?
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet and have had my feet measured to ensure the right size. 10.5 wide was a PERFECT fit for me with the Brooks Ghost 10. But I thought maybe I could save a little money and get some Saucony's. I've had some in the past and liked them too... but these shoes don't feel like a wide-width at all. They feel even narrower than my normal D-width Asics. I feel like something is off. Almost like they put the wrong label on these shoes. Put them on, took a couple of steps and put them back in the box. Very uncomfortable and disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: bhoyos

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: These are the worse shoes I ever bought. Unfortunately I can't send them back because I ordered them two months ago while out of town and now my window to send back is expired. Almost ZERO cushion and little or no arch support. I owned a pair of Saucony's years ago and remembered them being very nice shoes but these are junk. I will stick with New Balance from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Ksalmon104

customer_reviews.title: Insoles Too Firm
customer_reviews.text: Returned these suckers. I've had it with Saucony. Been a fan for over 15 years. Lately the insoles are too firm, the width around the instep too narrow. Wore them one day to see how they felt before my race. Good thing I did. My feet and ankles were all swollen by end of day from the hard impact. Had to soak them a few days in Epsom salt they were so tender. Returned them. Easy return. Quick refund from seller. This was my first Amazon return ever. Been purchasing over 12 years.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila W

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Saucony's
customer_reviews.text: I'm a former collegiete XC/T&F runner that use to buy the high end saucony's that cost 150 bucks thinking they would keep me from getting injured and help me train better. After having these for a few weeks, I can certainly say they may be my favorite running shoe to date. They fit and feel like other Saucony models and are a great every day shoe for walking/running/hiking ect. Saucony's always last at least 400 miles and these seem well built to make that happen, and the price is just icing on the cake. I wear a size 9 and these fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: it's not uncomfortable and actually feels like it provides good overall support
customer_reviews.text: While the size is just a touch smaller than expected, it's not uncomfortable and actually feels like it provides good overall support. The heel construction of these shoes allows for some slippage when you run and resulted in small blisters on first the left heel and then the right. Some cloth tape on my heels solved the problem for now, but it's not ideal to say the least. They are ok for an inexpensive shoe, but if you do much running or walking, it's not the best option imho. I will keep these until they are worn out, but don't think I will replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fiinally a stylish comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoe hugs the foot comfortably, soles have a comfortable bounce, foot is held well in place by the laces so the foot does not slide to the front. All the things shoe manufacturers seem to have forgotten about. I have wide foot and shoe is medium (I wish it came in wide) but I've been wearing these shoes instead of my dress shoes for over a week and I don't like not to wear them. My feet do not hurt. I found my shoe.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I've put about 45 miles on these as of this review between running and hiking. These are very comfortable, and they didn't require any kind of break-in period. These beat some of the much more expensive running/training shoes I have purchased in the past. The construction seems to be pretty good, especially for the price I got them for. I will update this review if any problems pop up with more use.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M

customer_reviews.title: A very good value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good running shoe. The only fault would be the lack of arch support which can be remedied with a vivesole or similar insole. The shoes are light weight, flexible, well ventilated and shock absorbent. With pricing under fifty bucks its hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these...took a risk...paid off
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those purchases that you just make and HOPE works...and It did. Well made, can be used for running and workout out. They are comfortable and supportive. Love them. Actually bought a few extra pairs so don't have to worry about them not being around when my main pair goes.
customer_reviews.author: JPK17

customer_reviews.title: Came with hair covered in sole
customer_reviews.text: I encountered the same issue few other buyers had...one of the shoe was covered in some sort of hair inside the sole, not sure if it's pet hair or something else. I was doubting if the seller was selling used/refurbished shoe as brand new shoes....but the shoe looked decently new. The seller needs to check your storage and make sure all the pet hair or whatever it is are removed. This shoe is almost $50 and we shouldn't expect this kind of issue. Aside from this, light shoe great foot support, one star for the hair.
customer_reviews.author: silundablaster

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes and good price.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for the price. Very light and comfortable and really good traction on the sole! I would definitely recommend these. I normally go between size 11 1/2 and 12 in men's, depending on the shoe and brand. I ordered 12 in these and they seem to fit perfectly with just enough wiggle room for my toes.
customer_reviews.author: knicksfan

customer_reviews.title: Well built, high performance, perfect price
customer_reviews.text: I run ALOT, between 80-100 miles per month and so I go through shoes often. These have been my favorite shoes by far. Comfortable but also pretty light, maybe not a sprinters shoe but can easily carry a faster pace over a long distance. I used to only run with Asics but the prices have started to sky rocket over the last few years and the shoes stopped lasting as long. I've found my new brand of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: ! shoe fits
customer_reviews.text: I wear these seldom, Saucony's I must have 8 pair. I wear them seldom because they have never fit right. I wore them yesterday and that was the final straw. My right foot was killing me. I am a diabetic and sore feet can be big trouble. I should have sent them back I know and usually I'm not bashful and would have but for various reasons i didn't get it done.
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: Never Worn
customer_reviews.text: Over the past decade I have purchased many pairs of different styles of Saucony's. I've come to realize that I no longer can by them without first trying them on. I purchased 11 wide like my last many purchases. They came in and were very tight. I returned them and purchased 11 5 wide. They came in and my feet were "swimming" in them. I easily had well over an inch of empty space. I returned these too. I've given up trying to buy shoes online because it appears QC on size is not being done.
customer_reviews.author: G. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: As a first time buyer Of Saucony shoes I didn’t know what to expect except I thought that they would be attractive. After wearing them for two weeks, I can unequivocally say that they are one of the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn. They are well cushioned, have excellent support and well made. Definitely will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: clysdy

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Sneaker At A Good Price
customer_reviews.text: This Saucony sneaker, size 13 wide, fits me very well. Most Saucony seem to be fitting a bit more narrow on me, so I had to find a wide size. This sneaker is comfortable and seems to be the quality I've come to expect from Saucony over the years. I would buy another pair of this sneaker if there was any sort of variety. There has only been this blue in the size I purchased for quite some time now. Hopefully there are other colors, because I will buy again. I would recommend this sneaker in any size, but would especially recommend the 13 wide for anyone who feels the 13 'medium' is too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: MKfromPA

customer_reviews.title: Good running shoe, though maybe not for long distances
customer_reviews.text: I run about 175 miles per month, so I go through a lot of shoes. I had read that these $50-ish shoes run more like $100-ish shoes, so I figured it was worth giving them a try. I've put 50 or 60 miles on them so far, and I like them just fine. I can feel the insole on my left instep after a few miles, and I'm afraid that if I ran in these for more than 10 or 12 miles, I might develop a blister. Aside from that, they are really comfortable and provide good support, both on streets and sidewalks and on running trails.
customer_reviews.author: David Baker

customer_reviews.title: Not the comfort I am used to from Saucony.
customer_reviews.text: These simply do not have the same cushiony support that I am used to from Saucony. Won't buy these again. Update: I went running in them. Just awful. I have four pairs of Saucony Cohesions that are five years old, with holes in the mesh, foam tearing out of the inner heels, and they are truly more comfortable to run in then these. I bought the solid black ones. Maybe, for some reason, they are just substandard. But I sure won't risk buying a different color just to see if they suck less.
customer_reviews.author: Kate C.

customer_reviews.title: Years ago I had heel-spurs (plantars fasciitis). Because I ...
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I had heel-spurs (plantars fasciitis). Because I worked at a job that required I be on my feet all day, I tried many varieties of shoes before discovering Saucony. It worked for me, hopefully it will do the same for you! O, by the way, to get rid of the heel spurs, I took up martial arts. It was breaking boards with my feet that removed the formerly constant pain that I suffered.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: I love this shoe, too!
customer_reviews.text: I use SuperFeet insert orthodics with all my shoes, so most are comfortable and correct, but this last two I got from Amazon has proved to go beyond! I really love this shoe. It is very stable. I am Old, so only walk in them, but so far they are standing up better and the ones they replaced. and although this is a little "softer" than the GRID excursion TR10, I think that it is better for everyday wear, and is more appropriate for more formal occasions. (i.e.not as loud)
customer_reviews.author: Mark Tuckerman

customer_reviews.title: replaced my favorite old Saucony's and didn't let me down.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Saucony's. The first pair where my favorite running shoe of all time. I would always kid and say it was like walking on marshmallows because of the plush feel. This pair does feel a little more sturdy and definitely has more support than the previous pair. For the price I would imagine it would be hard to find a better quality running shoe. I would definitely recommend find these if you want an inexpensive pair with good support.
customer_reviews.author: JeremyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Heels wore out in 4 months
customer_reviews.text: These shoes hurt my heel when I first bought them. I had to transition into them by swapping my old worn out shoes until I had them broken in. Tennis shoes should not have this problem. They lasted for 4 months. The heels wore through on both shoes until my heels were ripped to shreds. I bought a different brand, and my feet are fine again. These are the cheapest worst piece of crap shoes I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Judy

customer_reviews.title: Great supportive shoe; perfect price; good color to not show dirt/grime.
customer_reviews.text: Great looking shoe. I don't use them for running. I wear them for walking so I cannot comment on their ability to endure running shoe torture!!! These Saucony's have good heel support strapping on the exterior of the shoe. The dark gray shoe body and light gray lower shoe/sole are great because the are supportive yet does not show dirt and grime. Mine cost $39.95 and compared to my local store with an equivalent shoe, this purchase was $30.00+ cheaper on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: day Lee Snell

customer_reviews.title: They fit my feet comfortably. They have decent traction in the snow
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of Saucony shoes. So far, I have no complaints what so ever. They fit my feet comfortably. They have decent traction in the snow. (I know, traction in the snow is not what a "running shoe" is supposed to be about. But, this is my "run around" pair of shoes until my work shoes die. Then, these lil buggers will be "work shoes.") They're priced right and the construction seems to be sturdy. I'd recommend these shoes with no hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Mook Dubious

customer_reviews.title: I ordered the same shoe size and make as I had before, Saucony s25339. too small this time.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the same shoe size and make as I had before, Saucony 11. What they sent me was too small. I am 70 yrs old. Thought I was having age related foot pain. Took NSAIDs but no help. Finally doctor saw the shoes and told me they are too small. I think Saucony mislabeled this pair. Would like to be able to send them back or get refund. Makes me cautious of buying shoes online anymore. The first pair were great fitting and performed well, thats why I reordered them. Please HELP me Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Lear

customer_reviews.title: Mine Ran Very Large
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 10 in almost every shoe. Unfortunately, I have to give up on Saucony sneakers. My first purchase of Triumph 4's ran a half size small. I returned those and ordered these Cohesion 10's in a 10.5. These came in way too big. I could fit two fingers behind the heel. My guess is they are more in the 11.5 to 12 size range. Ic an not comment on comfort and durability. The sizing from Saucony sizing is just too far off in both directions and that makes it difficult to know what size I should be ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Blaise

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Size 12 D (M). At age 75 and after spinal fusion and a heart attack, I no longer run. But I do take a brisk walk of 4-5 miles per day on concrete, asphalt, or paving base (a packed mixture of sand and fine gravel) 5-6 days per week. I am a supinator with high arches and have used Dr. Scholl's Sport massaging gel insoles in my previous walking shoes. Thus I replaced the original Saucony Cohesion 10 insoles with those, and the combination is comfortable for me. After the first 21 miles the Cohesion 10 outsoles look like they will hold up well. Assuming they do, I will replace them with Cohesion 10s when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Alfalfa

customer_reviews.title: Overall great shoe, will purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: Shoe held up great for a full summer playing flag football and everyday shoe. The back heel has stayed upright and the cushion is comfortable. It's not clumping like some of our previous purchases from slipping on and off without untying/tying. Very satisfied overall, however the liner is cheap. Used the liner until got holes, then purchased Dr. Schools athletic insole because there is plenty of life left in the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: hypnomama

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier with my Saucony shoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Have worn them a few times, but am very pleased with them so far. Fit is just fine. They give my feet plenty of support and my feet do not seem to get tired as rapidly as they do with other shoes I wear. Most of my other shoes make my feet feel "tired" and needing relief by taking them off after more then 6/7 hours of wear. My Saucony Cohesion 10 Running shoes still are comfortable after 8 yours of use. Wish Saucony made a shoe suitable for dress wear. I would snap up them up in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalio Ross Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.text: You never really know what to expect when ordering shoes online. Having said that, and ordering these, here is my opinion. This is a review after seven months wear. The wear is minimum. The shoe is light and well constructed. The fit is perfect for me. Style and color is great. I’ve had compliments on them. Best of all the fit, comfort and support is great making for some happy feet. Will definitely be ordering a couple more pairs for this summer.very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Jack G. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Size not the same as other Saucony shoes
customer_reviews.text: To begin, I only wear Saucony shoes. Since trying a pair several years ago my feet have never felt better. Normally I purchase shoes in their Guide line of products, but last week I decided to the try this one. Sadly, it was nothing close to the quality, fit, and comfort of the Guide line. The shoe feels almost a full size smaller than my Guide shoes despite being listed as the same size, and they are outstandingly uncomfortable. These are being returned, and I will go back to the Guide with great pleasure. I still love Saucony, I just won't ever be trying a Cohesion shoe from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I just did my first two days in these shoes. They are ok, well made, and decent arch support. Comfort wise I would give them a 7/10, okay to wear for a day but happy to take them off once home. The shoe is supposed to be wide but any extra width was hard to notice. I have regular width feet but find wider fits usually more comfy (I am a registered nurse and stand long periods). I would order a half size up if I was going to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: I think the shoe is discontinued.  I bought a pair of these at DSW.
customer_reviews.text: I liked them so much, I purchased another pair on Amazon. I have to say it was slightly different than the shoe at DSW. It was basically the same, but I think it was a few centimeters smaller than the DSW shoe. It still fit me though. I like the heel support. It seems like so many of the lightweight running shoes have very little support. This one has plenty in the heel and the arch. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: F. N. Weinstein

customer_reviews.title: My favorite brand, this cohesion are great for mid distance and XT
customer_reviews.text: Saucony is my favorite brand for running and XT shoes, I have had many of this shoes accordingly with the distance and purpose. In this case, cohesion are working perfect for the gym and cross training, breathable, light, fits great and very confortable. I do use E/2E because in saucony the standard fit is a bit tight for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Athletic Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe and good price. I have always been a Reebok fan but this shoe is by far the most comfortable sports shoe I have bought in a long time. I saw the show at a DSW store and tried it on and loved it! The price on Amazon was $10.00 cheaper than DSW. I think I have found my new favorite athletic shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Schrider

customer_reviews.title: One shoe squeaks and they aren't very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: When I first got these shoes I noticed they weren't very comfortable but I figured they would break in but they never got much better. Also, after a week after I couldn't return them to Amazon one of the shoes started to squeak with every step. I can't figure out why it squeaks but it's quite annoying. I'm very disappointed with these shoes and would not recommend them at all. I have owned Saucony shoes in the past and they were decent but this will probably be the last pair of Saucony's I buy.
customer_reviews.author: Brant Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Shoe is narrower than expected
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews said this shoe was cut narrow and they were correct. I decided on this shoe because I am on my feet all day and wanted a running shoe thinking it would be easier on the feet. If I keep moving they are fine but if I stop for a few my toes start to tingle. Shoe is nice and light but does cramp my feet. I normally ware a D width and these are a bit tight. If you decide on these maybe go up half a size or try to get a wider version.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Desmonie

customer_reviews.title: Fair purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought "Nike running 10" couple months ago and between both shoes Nike give me more comfortable but, the sole wears out faster and the shoe doesn't have much durability. I believe that this brand and model will have more durability compared to my first purchase. Tennis is great, but in order to earn 5 stars this shoe need to provide more comfort and cushioning when walking.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Excuses gone
customer_reviews.text: In the spirit of a true review, it is only fair to open the review with the fact that I’m another overweight victim of the COVID quarantine...so yes, I’ve put on some 12 lbs that I’m trying to lose. That said, these running shoes provide the support and cushion I needed while I negotiate with the forces of gravity in my knees and ankles. No complaints there at all. Furthermore, they give me the stability I needed to prevent over arching while walking/running. The only downside of these running shoes is that I lo longer have an excuse to exercise comfortably. Oh well...I guess I can’t win them all...
customer_reviews.author: TomA

customer_reviews.title: Annoying bulge at mid sole not for serious running
customer_reviews.text: I have other Saucony shoes and the Cohesion model is not up to par. The outer covering is good and they are sized correctly for my 10W feet, but there is a strange bulge at the mid sole my others don't have. I have normal arches and normally do not have any issue. You will especially notice the bulge if you strike with your heel, so maybe if you are a forefoot runner or if you have really high arches you would not notice it. I may use them for a walking shoe but I can't use them for running.
customer_reviews.author: John Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Could use better cushion
customer_reviews.text: It has been years since I wore Saucony brand running shoes. The fit was right on (size 11) but a couple of things needed adjustments. The insoles have to go. They are too thin and for my needs, worthless. I replaced them with Dr. Scholls inserts and there was an improvement but the ball of the foot could still use better cushion, for my specific need of cross country running with a slight overweight problem. If you intend to use them for walking they might work better.
customer_reviews.author: Mancave Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe But Too Narrow in the Arch
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good shoe (especially for the price). It's comfortable and the toe and heel have plenty of room (at least the wide option, I had an 11.5 E). The problem was the arch area was too narrow and provided no support in the arch for my foot. This wasn't a case where I didn't like the arch support, it literally wasn't there. My arch was landing onto the side of the shoe v. the sole of the shoe. Unfortunately, I can't give anymore insight as I didn't have the opportunity to run in them as I returned since they didn't support the arch of my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Bayern11

customer_reviews.title: Needs a few days break in...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son for multiple activities. After the first few days of breaking them in, he loves them. At first they felt like there was a little pressure in the smallest toe area, but after the break in period, they are fine. He has been wearing them for 2 months and so far they are holding up great! They are light weight but very well constructed, we will purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect right off the bat!
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and feel! First time I tried these on, they were just what I needed (having been a dedicated Aasics guy until their shoes starting getting near Nubalance prices). Let's see how long they last, though. I'll update when they are near flat. Update 3/28/2020: these shoes have lasted quite a while now, and are still as comfortable as ever. I no longer run in them (I just don't run anymore) but rather use them for walking and biking because they're cushy on the knees and also breathe well for sweat evaporation. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: A. Bombac

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe! Great Reputation! Great Fit! Great Price! Under $60.00
customer_reviews.text: Ease of ordering online made it safe during COVID-19. Having prior experience with Saucony running shoes (although I use them mostly for walking in neighborhood and occasionally some light sport activities and casual attire out for dinner). Fits like a glove but not too tight. I think this Saucony Cohesion is a bit narrower than my Saucony Glide 3. But that was okay as I don't like lacing my shoes up so tight that the strings hang way down (not too good for bike riding). Overall happy with seller (fast shipping and free with Prime).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Men's Cohesion TR10
customer_reviews.text: I usually stay away from this price range due to quality level. But these Saucony TR10 are great fitting, quality shoes. The heal spine is firm and supportive. I previously had plantar problems and this shoes keep it in check. I swapped out the insole for a product with better arch rise. I was satisfied enough to buy a few other colors. I bought a 1/2 size larger for more insole pad room. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine Test Lab

customer_reviews.title: It is far away from Cohesion 8 and 9. Be aware.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this brand, used 8 series 9.5. Then I ordered 9-series, and size 9.5 was way smaller. Then I bought 10-series (they hadn't decent choice of 9s), 10size, and it is somewhat bigger. In general, I like my 2years old 8s more. Aug 05 Update. Eventually I should admit: I don't like it. The previous Cohesions were way better than this. I'm going to buy a new training shoes for active sports and use these only in a gym.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy

customer_reviews.title: ON THE RUN
customer_reviews.text: I had worn Saucony several years ago and thought it was time to go back to the old reliable Saucony. Went for a run this evening and the shoes felt good. A little tight, but with any of my shoes purchases that's always the case. I 'll be better able to review them after a few runs over six miles. But for now the price was good and received the shoes in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Lone Sentry

customer_reviews.title: Not for flat feet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and very lightweight. It doesn't get 5 stars because the arch support becomes painful after a while when I run due to my flat feet. I was not aware the arch support was substantial, so perhaps that can be mentioned in the product description to help others.
customer_reviews.author: TaquitosAreGood

customer_reviews.title: Heel spurs try Saucony's
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe have been wearing Saucony's since I was diagnosed with heel spurs in both feet. About 20 yrs ago I bought a pair because of the heel cushion. Had orthotics in my dress shoes but the Saucony's felt awesome as soon as I put them on. A few days later noticed that my pain was a lot less. Now it's only Saucony's for me. And my heels spurs don't bother me anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Bigkahuna57

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: I was on a time constraint to run in a 5K (my first one ever) with a friend and needed a running shoe. Ordered this shoe and received it on a Friday and was running the next day. Wore them for about an hour or so running errands and whatnot on that Friday and then put them on the next morning for the 5K and ran it without an issue. They fit great with no break in required and were very comfortable to run in. Have been running in them ever since and would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: RJ69

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, nice looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband was reluctant to buy a shoe without trying them on. I bought him the same size as his other sneakers and they fit perfectly. He said they are very comfortable and thanked me multiple times for buying them for him. We play pickle ball and he said they were so much better in comfort and traction than his other sneakers. They are true to size and very comfortable. We would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe - feels like I'm walking on a huge ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe - feels like I'm walking on a huge cushion - the tread is incredibly grippy, here in the high desert in California we have lots of sand, rocks, and slippery terrain. Really like these shoes - they're a little small even though I got a .5 bigger size (thanks to other reviewers). Even on uneven ground, the shoes hold their own perfectly - I don't feel like I'll twist my ankle (even though I tried). Great shoe, great price! Been using Saucony shoes for awhile now - they continue to impress.
customer_reviews.author: P. McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Great Running Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because I love my Cohesion 9 which have now accumulated too many miles. About ten miles in on these and I find they are a little different, but, see just as good. The shoe offers medium/soft sole that still offers the right support to keep me injury free. I expect to find that these shoes hold up for many, many miles just like my last pair. I am sure you can't beat this shoe for the price if you are a daily fitness runner without special needs.
customer_reviews.author: Tntophat

customer_reviews.title: Great $ great quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace another popular brand that caused my feet to hurt. I'm always on my feet for 10 hour shifts. After wearing these for a short time my feet reverted back to normal, no more pain. These are now my new brand. Very comfortable and lightweight. Well made and airy with a durable sole
customer_reviews.author: Tech Junkie

customer_reviews.title: An affordable Saucony
customer_reviews.text: When I ran a lot I used Saucony, well, because the last just fit my foot really well. Three knee and one foot operations later, I don't run anymore so I went to Asics. Good shoe for the price, but I missed THIS fit. I am so glad I bought these. They feel like they have an aftermarket insole in them! Ahhhhhh.
customer_reviews.author: Saltydog

customer_reviews.title: Wear right away to make sure the soles are okay.
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair these before that were fine. The ones I just ordered though the soles feel deformed and the support is far too much right behind the arch of the foot. This is especially true for the right shoe. This is to the point I have decided I probably should not even continue wearing them for the sake of my feet. Unfortunately by the time I got around to wearing these to discover this the return window closed so... I recommend trying them on right away to make sure the soles are okay.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit review
customer_reviews.text: I have barely worn these, so I am not going to give 5 stars yet. I buy men's athletic shoes because I have a wide width. I normally wear an 8.5 or 9 in women's, equating to a 7 or 7.5 in men's. I add a half size, because your feet swell when you walk long distances, bringing me to 7.5 or 8. The other reviews said these run a shade small, and I have other Saucony shoes that I have gotten an 8.5 in in the past and been very happy with, so I ordered an 8.5 and the fit seems to be perfect, especially with athletic socks or footies.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Seymour

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. I bought them to work in and go to the gym and since I burn through shoes like crazy, the price was right. Very happy so far. Very light and comfortable, and great for short runs and to wear while weight training because the heel isn’t too dramatic. Toe box is a bit narrow if you have wide feet but it’s stretched out nice after wearing for 2 weeks and isn’t a problem. Would buy again, nice shoe!
customer_reviews.author: David Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great support, fit and are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: it was reported that the toe box was tight and to order a half size bigger. I ordered my regular size and they fit perfect. My heels have a tendency to slip a little, but not with these. I don’t run much but I do a lot of walking. These are very comfortable. I would purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brune

customer_reviews.title: Durable Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are well-constructed. I don't even run in them. They follow the shape of the foot. The shoe has curves. They aren't bulky. I like them for everyday use. They are very lightweight! Super lightweight. I like that a lot. You can wear them daily for other uses than running.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Teems Jr

customer_reviews.title: Buying more to make sure I have them
customer_reviews.text: Never used Saucony before. I really like these. Bought to Saucony. This and another style. The back on these are a little lower than the other style. I like running in these more. I have mechanical issues so I go through a lot of shoes to find one I like. Then they stop making them and I start over.
customer_reviews.author: First tram

customer_reviews.title: Good for slender man
customer_reviews.text: I have a slender build/bone structure. Had another pair of these type shoes for 3 years before they started peeling from the front sole. Used for running, hiking, working my seasonal job as a painter's assistant. I love the breathability, comfort, durability and low profile look.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: compare to cohesion 9
customer_reviews.text: I am a faithful of the Saucony Cohesion brand. I run between 30 to 50 kilometers between asphalt and treadmill. Always with the best materials. This is my third generation. Something I feel is that they have used less material and the shoe feels very light. On the treadmill is perfect. On the street it feels like something is missing. It gives great support. But for some reason I feel that the quality is slightly lower than the 8 and 9 series. Cohesion 9 is my favorite! But this also has its good performance.
customer_reviews.author: AAA

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my lanky 14 year old that takes a size 13 shoe. He gets serious growing pains. Saucony are one of the most comfortable shoes for him. Being a teenager he likes higher end name brands but admits to this brand being the most comfortable shoe for his growing flat feet. I’ve given it four stars because Cohesion quality is a downgrade from the other styles. Still, this was an excellent deal!
customer_reviews.author: Aza

customer_reviews.title: The shoe looks pretty good and seems to be solidly made
customer_reviews.text: The shoe looks pretty good and seems to be solidly made. They are also pretty comfortable but may not have enough padding if you need a lot of padding in your running shoes. I'd say it's a solid runner (for some) and cross trainer. Was very happy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Carle

customer_reviews.title: My least favorite Saucony I have purchased
customer_reviews.text: I have always bought Saucony size 12 with no issue. This shoe is more narrow and tighter but still wearable. sole feels too tall and soft for trail running. I would not run on anything but smooth pavement in these because of stability concerns. This is my least favorite Saucony to date. will go back to running shoe in the future. This is my 2nd trail runner from Saucony and I will go back to a training shoe or something.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stopford

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, good color
customer_reviews.text: I'm a recreational runner recovering from IT band syndrome. I also have virtually no arches in my feet and have had knee and ankle problems since childhood. That said, these shoes have been great so far. There's not too much arch support, but they're not pancake flat either. They have good cushioning and for running on a treadmill, they're comfortable. I keep a pair at the gym, but plan to buy another for races and will update this after running outdoors on different surfaces. I'm a huge fan of the color; it was one of the reasons I bought these.
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Thirty miles in and rolling...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Saucony Cohesion 10 after burning the first pair out over a couple hundred miles. I am a 200+ lb runner so I need to support and cushion these shoes offer. I have been a Saucony fan since high school (90's) and tried other brands a few times and keep coming back. I look forward to putting a couple hundred miles on these...
customer_reviews.author: Richard G

customer_reviews.title: Good comfortable fit right from day one
customer_reviews.text: The only negative comment I have is that the shoe always come with laces that are way, way too long and therefore drag on the floor and could trip you. I always have to go and buy much shorter laces before I can wear the shoes. This seems so obvious that it should have been corrected a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: wsjggj

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Lost Their Mojo
customer_reviews.text: Just not right - there is something about the foot bed and the sole that keeps me off kilt. My feet are just not squared up in these shoes - I feel tilted and insecure. The footbed is unresponsive and awkward. I just came off Hoka, and before that Mizuno. Both shoes were significantly better than this. I sent them back and bought Adidas Bounce instead and those so far are working well - very stable and just enough padding.
customer_reviews.author: MrVenom

customer_reviews.title: Overall fit well, heel on bottom of shoe has hollow area that is a bit uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like these, they fit well and air out my feet well. The main reason I gave a 4 instead of a 5 is that there is a hollow part under the heel that while it gives more flex, it gets a bit uncomfortable around the edge of my heel since the inner part of my heel sinks while the outer edge is held up. So that difference in support becomes a bit uncomfortable. But I'll keep these until they wear out and would consider the same brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Reid Raisanen

customer_reviews.title: Not a running shoe, but good nonetheless.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't plan on running any long distances in these; these are really more of a work/referee/coaching shoe. They fit well, and are reasonably comfortable, it appears to be well made. Extremely lightweight. I certainly would not use them for running though. I wear them on a daily basis to work, and for the price, I bought two pair and I switch them out about every six months. For $40, you really can't beat that. The all-black look goes well with the government uniform I have to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Hobie CatTop Contributor: Boxing

customer_reviews.title: Decently lasting non non meshed shoe
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cheap everyday shoe that I could also use for the occasional jog, but I was particularly looking for one that was not meshed. I hate getting water inside the shoe through the mesh because of random splashes. This was the only one I could find in my price range. This has held up decently although my toenails did cause a slight tear in the fabric part. For the price, I can't complain too much though.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Deshmukh

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight shoe, comfy and held up very well ! On feet a lot and happy on purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe ! Seemed to hold up well ! I wrote review months l later for true assessment, I am on feet 10 hours a day, wal alot, these did great ! Light and supportive! Added inserts after 4 months brought back to life, still holding up, would buy again thanks
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Decent value
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have worked out pretty well for me, although I've only tested them with moderate walking. Comfortable but there's already some deterioration where the laces rub up against cushioning. Changed the lacing configuration eliminated the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Mooney

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable and supportive!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband because of his new job at the Emergency Room was going to require a lot of walking for very long hours. He is VERY hard to find good shoes for, so I was skeptical, but they've been fantastic!! He loves them and says they're the most comfortable shoes he's ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: ldb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this show. I’ve always been a Nike Running shoe guy for when I go to the gym or for a run. I bought these to try something “outside” the box. I ordered a pair that was a wide, it fits very well and is comfortable. After about 8 months, I decided to replace my everyday shoe with a pair. 5 Stars
customer_reviews.author: Nick Smith

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Sneaker
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a good general sneaker, search no further. These are great on a treadmill, doing squats, or even just walking around. They provide adequate protection and comfort, and they’re pretty light, too. After four months of regular use, these have held up very well, and could pass as new. The lime green and gray aesthetic works well for me (I have an Apple Watch with the Nike Volt/Anthracite band, and they match nicely). Probably the best sneaker out there for $50 or less.
customer_reviews.author: Panah N

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are a good value.
customer_reviews.text: For about $40.00, I think these shoes are a good value. I wear these shoes just about every day commuting to work and they last about a 1.5 years. I glue, from the inside, a piece of old gardening glove leather in the area where the big toe comes in contact with the upper. This is the weakest point in the shoe. I like the grey and black version. I weigh about 145 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Recycled

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Read lots of negative reviews about these shoes but bought them anyway. They are very comfortable and like most Saucony shoes, were perfectly broken in after a few times wearing them. Have had them for a few months now and they are holding up well. No complaints and very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eric White

customer_reviews.title: Great value running shoe
customer_reviews.text: A lot better than the cohesion 9. Extremely comfortable for being only $60, on par with more expensive shoes like asics and they also look pretty good as well.
customer_reviews.author: JEFF

customer_reviews.title: Big fan of Saucony shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many other brands (you know all the usual suspects). Most of those left my feet sore or were just uncomfortable. Every pair of Saucony shoes I have ever worn fit and feel great. These were no exception and they look great too.
customer_reviews.author: Jchumpfree

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit, Comfortable, Average Wear
customer_reviews.text: I've been a user of Saucony since 2008. I particularly like the Cohesion line as they're one of the few options that are applicable for people with a neutral gait and a wide foot. While I do like these sneakers, I'm slightly heavier and they have a tendency to wear down a little more quickly than I like. As for fit, they fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in PA

customer_reviews.title: Incredible shoe for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these 7 months ago. Fit - Perfect. I wear size 10-10.5 EE (wide as hell feet), but I got these in a 10 and they slip on my feet like loafers and they feel amazing. Wear - Minimal for what I do. I bought these for the gym, but I ended up running in them as well due to comfort. 6-8 miles of running a week. I wear them while lifting. I wear them while running errands. I'm wearing them as I type this. No damage whatsoever. Sidenote - I love how breathable these are. If I wear them without socks, the cool air feels incredibly soothing on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this model to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I’m not familiar with Sacony products . I thought that they made a quality product similar to Nike. I was wrong or maybe this particular model was not representative of the brand. I found this model to be somewhat small, non supportive, and basically uncomfortable. I would not recommend this model to anyone. I would return them if I hadn’t already worn them on multiple occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Who needs expensive shoes when you have these!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Saucony Cohesion's for over 10 years now and they are not only cheap but serve me well out in the roads and withstand marathon distance running and the training that leads to the race. I laugh at my friends when they tell me they pay over $100 for running shoes. I log about 300 miles before replacing them and have never encountered quality issues.
customer_reviews.author: HortGuy

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoy these
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit great. I'm generally pretty hard on shoes (~210lbs and active) and i've put quite a few miles on these. I came from nice Brooks running shoes so I was worried but these are quite comfortable and supportive at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K.

customer_reviews.title: Nope!
customer_reviews.text: I love giving great reviews but honestly, this is my second pair of the Cohesion Model Saucony's and they just aren't comfortable. First Pair I bought is at least seven years old and I still wear them on occasion. I ordered the same size this time and they pinch my feet as if they aren't really Wide's? I will just give them to my son. His feet are narrow and he will likely love them.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes for trail and treadmill!
customer_reviews.text: These were my first Saucony shoes. I run a 5K everyday and these are awesome. I have run 450 miles (trail and treadmill combined) wearing these as well as walked over 800 miles in them They finally started to fray a bit and are now back-ups to my new Saucony Kinvara 7s. I would highly recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mukul Krishna

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: Product is ok. Not comparable to past saucany shoes I have had in the past (costing double to triple the price $100-$120). The best comparison I can make is if you go to the outlet for a designer product for a discounted price. Looks like the product, but quality isint there. Ok for the gym and running moderately. Would not recommend if you run everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Standard but kinda cruddy
customer_reviews.text: There's no hard plastic frame at all - it's all just foam. I went for a run and walked a bit and my feet started to hurt. I still wear them here and there but after a bit I can feel the cheap foam is starting to make my joints over compensate.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Frechette

customer_reviews.title: Great walking (10 Wide) shoe (10,000 steps daily)
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Great fit (10 Wide), insole is comfortable, breathable, laces stretch to help make a secure fit. Rich blue color Con: None Usage: I wear them weekly for walking (10,000 steps) without any discomfort in toes, heal or top of foot. I will get another pair/color when the price is right again.
customer_reviews.author: S Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Tight
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 11.5 EE in both New Balance and Merrell, but these were WAY snug when I put them on. Uncomfortably tight really. Snug in length also- easily a 1/2 size size smaller for me. However- Nice shoes and delivered right on time so I can't complain ( free return).
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wohlslagel

customer_reviews.title: Not as well cushioned as the previous models.
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers, I'm a little disappointed in the Cohesion 10 over previous iterations. They fit well, but the sole doesn't seem to have as much cushion to it as the previous models. So, I feel the pavement more with these. The price is still very reasonable, but I hope this trend with the lower part of this shoe does not continue. Otherwise, it's on to something else.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin J Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Basic general exercise shoe
customer_reviews.text: Basic general exercise shoe rather than a specific running shoe. I am slightly disappointed by this model as I have had a several pairs of Saucony running shoes before this which were superior. In saying that, they are comfortable and fit as expected. A solid general exercise shoe but I will be buying a slightly more expensive running specific shoe next time.
customer_reviews.author: Luke B

customer_reviews.title: Asics level comfort for bargain bin price.
customer_reviews.text: It's a $40 shoe that feels like an $80 shoe. Work walking on concrete for 8 hours, feet feel great. Got the wide size and fits my wide high arch foot very well. Only took two days to break in. Perfect shoe for work if you have to replace shoes every six months. Lighter and more flexible than expected. Soft mesh upper is very breathable. It keeps feet cool and conforms well to the side of a wide foot.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

product_meta.title: Saucony Men's S25339-1 Trail Runner
product_meta.description: Each mountain path is defined by a trailblazer and now is the time to be your own pioneer with the Cohesion Tr10. With a specific outsole and a durable outer material, this journey gives a new meaning to play dirty.
